strings.onboardLongDescription: Lay out in the sun and enjoy the restaurant and club-lined promenade, go on an Art tour that accentuates the cultures that call Cape Town home, peruse the goods, food options and live music at The Neighbourgoods Market or Greenmarket Square.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.shortDescription: See Cape Town from a different perspective
activities.longDescription: After departing the quayside and transferring to the Atlantic Seaboard you’ll meet your guide for a 2-hour Kayak experience taking in the unparalleled beauty of Table Mountain, Lions Head, Green Point Lighthouse and the eclectic architecture that lines the coastline. Depending on the day, see the dolphins, seals, penguins and occasional whales that inhabit the waters you’re kayaking before ending your day with a refreshing drink or snack at a local Seaboard cafe before returning to the pier.
highlightDetails: See various landmarks and wildlife
Take a 2-hour guided kayaking tour
activities.introduction: Take this 2-hour guided kayaking experience to see Cape Town’s various wildlife, picturesque views and sparkling waters.
instructionDetails: Wildlife sightings are likely but not guaranteed
Double kayaks, single Sailors will be paired up
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship
Maximum weight is 100kgs
Approximately 2 hours of kayaking
Temperature on the water may be chilly. A jacket is recommended
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate

activities.shortDescription: Spend a half day in two iconic Cape Town spots
activities.longDescription: Once departing the pier you’ll drive to Simons Town, where your first stop will be Boulders Beach, home of the jackass penguins – the only penguins found on the continent of Africa. Spend an hour viewing their nesting grounds and learning about the colony before taking a short drive to Kalk Bay, a harbor town that’s still a favorite place for locals to buy the freshest fish. Peruse their unique shops filled with eclectic home-grown goods before returning to Cape Town Harbour.
highlightDetails: Spend time perusing the shops of Kalk Bay
Learn about the penguins of Boulders Beach
Drive to Simons Town
activities.introduction: Spend half a day exploring the African Penguins of Boulders Beach before exploring the quaint fishing town at Kalk Bay.
instructionDetails: Approximately 1 hour of free time Kalk Bay
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship

activities.displayName: Chapman's Peak & Ou Kaapse Weg Driving Tour
activities.shortDescription: Spend a half day seeing iconic landmarks & sights
activities.longDescription: Departing the quayside you’ll begin your scenic drive along the Atlantic coast, passing through Sea Point, Bantry Bay, Clifton and Camps Bay before stopping at Maiden’s Cove to take in the views. From there you’ll go through Llandudno and the fishing village of Hout Bay before traveling the iconic Chapman’s Peak Drive for even more incredible views. Then, pass the glistening white sand of Noordhoek Beach, Cape Flats and False Bay and more before heading back to the city via the M3 motorway.
highlightDetails: Drive iconically scenic Ou Kaapse Weg (Old Cape Road)
Travel up Chapman’s Peak Drive
Drive along the Atlantic Coast
activities.introduction: Take a scenic drive through the Atlantic coasts’ hotspots, Chapman’s Peak Drive and its lookout points, Hout Bay, the Sentinel & so much more.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as long as Sailors can navigate a few steps on their own
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Tour is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights
Views are weather dependent
Panoramic tour with photo stops along the way
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship

activities.shortDescription: Make the most of your debarkment
activities.longDescription: Departing the pier with your luggage you’ll head to Cape Town International Airport, stopping first at a picturesque wine estate where you’ll indulge in a formal wine and cheese pairing, where each of the five hand-selected wines are carefully paired with local cheeses. After this, you’ll head to Stellenbosch, South Africa's most beautiful inland town featuring oak-lined streets, stunning architecture and national monuments, where you’ll have time to shop and explore before your flight home.
highlightDetails: Tour Stellenbosch before heading to the airport
Stop at a picturesque wine estate along the way
After disembarking the ship with your luggage head to Cape Town International Airport
activities.introduction: End your journey at a picturesque estate for a formal wine and cheese tasting before driving to tour Stellenbosch and Cape Town International Airport.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is only available for disembarking Sailors with flights after 6:00pm, or those staying in Cape Town
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Please be aware international flights should depart CPT 3 hours after arrival

activities.shortDescription: See the endless flora & fauna of Southern Africa
activities.longDescription: Begin your day on a scenic drive to Cape Point Nature Reserve, seeing sights along the way before arriving at the 19,150 acres of indigenous flora at the Good Hope Nature Reserve where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans converge. Next, you’ll take the funicular to the top of Cape Point for views. Then head to a local scenic restaurant for lunch before heading to the Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden, Table Mountain, Boulders Beach to see an African penguin colony and so much more.
highlightDetails: Tour Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden
Take the funicular railway to the top of Cape Point
Explore the Cape Point Nature Reserve
activities.introduction: Spend the day taking in the thousands of acres of Nature Reserve, eclectic villages, Botanical Gardens, dramatic sea cliffs and (so much) more.
instructionDetails: Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Tour is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights
The order of sites visited may vary
Sailors should expect long periods of driving
Views are weather dependent
This shore thing will not be going to the top of Table Mountain

activities.shortDescription: Travel to the heart of South African Wine Country
activities.longDescription: After departing the pier you’ll head to Franschhoek, stopping along the way at Babylonstoren, a quintessential Cape Dutch Farm turned botanical paradise. From there you’ll head to an impressive estate for a formal wine tasting before heading to Boschendal Wine Estate for more wine and lunch. After lunch, you’ll drive to the Huguenot Monument and Memorial Museum. Next, you’ll drive to Stellenbosch, a picturesque wine country town with quaint shops before heading back to Cape Town Harbor.
highlightDetails: Explore Stellenbosch
Taste wine at multiple estates
Explore Babylonstoren Cape Dutch Farm
activities.introduction: Spend the day in the heart of South African Wine Country, indulging in fresh fruits and wine tastings and seeing local landmarks along the way.
instructionDetails: Alcohol purchases will be retained at the gangway and delivered to the Sailor’s cabin on the last evening of the voyage by the Housekeeping Crew
Approximately 1 hour and 45-minute drive each way to/from the pier
Sailors should advise of any dietary restrictions or allergies in advance of the experience
This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as long as Sailors can navigate a few steps on their own
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship
Order of sites and locations are subject to change

activities.shortDescription: Spend a half day wine tasting & viewing seals
activities.longDescription: After departing the pier you’ll take the scenic drive to Constantia Estate, seeing the views of Table Mountain and Devil’s Peak along the way. Once arrived, you’ll tour the impressive grounds and taste the locally-sourced wine and chocolate before driving to Hout Bay, a popular fishing harbor. Here, you’ll board your 1-hour cruise to see the Cape Fur seals, Duiker Island, Kabonkelberg Mountain Range and the shipwrecks of Maori Bay before taking the scenic drive home.
highlightDetails: Experience a 1-hour cruise to see Cape Fur Seals and more
Take a tour and tasting at Constantia Estate
Take a scenic drive past Table Mountain
activities.introduction: Spend a half day wine & chocolate tasting at one of South Africa’s oldest wine farms before taking a 1-hour cruise to see seals & shipwrecks.
instructionDetails: Alcohol purchases will be retained at the gangway and delivered to the Sailor’s cabin on the last evening of the voyage by the Housekeeping Crew
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Weather may be or get chilly — pack accordingly and wear layers
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship

activities.displayName: Groot Constantia Wine Tasting & Table Mountain
activities.shortDescription: See a magnificent estate & a natural landmark
activities.longDescription: Departing from the quayside you’ll travel 30 minutes to Groot Constantia Estate. Once the private home of a Dutch Governor, this magnificent Cape Dutch homestead flawlessly blends African, European and Asian ideas and materials. After touring the estate with your guide you’ll experience a formal wine tasting before reboarding to head to Table Mountain, where you’ll be able to take in the jaw-dropping panoramic views of Table Bay and Robben Island before returning to the pier through Cape Town.
highlightDetails: Take a cable car to see Table Mountain
Experience a formal wine tasting at Groot Constantia Estate
Tour Groot Constantia Estate
activities.introduction: Visit the iconic Groot Constantia Estate, an impressive Dutch homestead before tasting wine & seeing Table Mountain by cable car.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is weather dependent
Views are weather dependent
Tour is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship
Alcohol purchases will be retained at the gangway and delivered to the Sailor’s cabin on the last evening of the voyage by the Housekeeping Crew
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
The order of sites visited may vary
Sailors may encounter lines for the cable car at Table Mountain and delays may occur

activities.shortDescription: Tour this historically remarkable island on foot
activities.longDescription: An outcrop of rock formed millions of years ago, Robben Island has been a place of imprisonment most famously for the likes of Nelson Mandela and poet Dennis Brutus during the struggle against Apartheid in South Africa. Currently, it’s a UNESCO-World Heritage Site you’ll arrive at through the Nelson Mandela Gateway. You’ll go on a 2-hour visit and walking tour of the various historical attractions here while learning about everything that went on here and seeing the wildlife that now live here.
highlightDetails: View the local flora and fauna that now live here
Take a walking tour of the historical sites of Robben Island
Take a ferry from the terminal located at the Nelson Mandela Gateway
activities.introduction: Tour this infamous island, a place of exile and imprisonment that’s become synonymous with the political struggle against Apartheid in South Africa.
instructionDetails: Photocopy of passport required to board ferry
Ferry is weather dependent
Approximately 30 minute walk to and from ferry
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship

activities.shortDescription: Spend the day walking, talking & tasting
activities.longDescription: After departing the pier you’ll take the scenic drive to Stellenbosch, a fertile valley founded in 1680 that’s the second oldest town in South Africa. With charming oak-lined streets, eclectic architecture, impressive art exhibitions and a famous food and wine, scene your day is bound to be amazing. You’ll take a guided tour of the Old Town Centre with a knowledgeable guide who will provide you with craft beers, traditional and local snacks, fresh bread and more before returning to the pier.
highlightDetails: Provided food and drink
Guided tour of Stellenbosch’s Old Town Centre
Scenic drive to Stellenbosch
activities.introduction: Spend the day strolling Stellenbosch, a quaint town & impressive wine region on a guided walking tour – with tempting tastes along the way.
instructionDetails: Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Approximately 1 hour drive to/from pier
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship
Sailors should advise of any dietary restrictions or allergies in advance of the experience

activities.shortDescription: Spend time exploring this breathtaking region
activities.longDescription: After leaving the pier and departing the quayside you’ll travel to Stellenbosch, a unique inland town known for its beauty, architecture, oak-lined streets and all-encompassing beauty. Here you’ll have time to wander around, visit the four houses of the Stellenbosch Museum, grab a bite at a local cafe, have a drink or peruse the unique shops before heading to one of Stellenbosch’s impressive wine estates where you’ll indulge in a wine tasting before returning to the pier.
highlightDetails: Have a wine tasting at a local estate
Explore Stellenbosch on your own time
Drive to Stellenbosch
activities.introduction: Spend time seeing the various landmarks, shops and architecture of Stellenbosch before enjoying a wine tasting in one of its prolific estates.
instructionDetails: Alcohol purchases will be retained at the gangway and delivered to the Sailor’s cabin on the last evening of the voyage by the Housekeeping Crew
Approximately 1 hour drive each way to/from the pier
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship

activities.shortDescription: Spend a half day at this notable landmark
activities.longDescription: You’ll depart from the quayside and head up to Kloof Nek to the lower cableway station. From there you’ll ascend through a few stations for a quick, but notable, 4-minute cable car ride, enjoying panoramic views during the ascent and descent. Once arrived you’ll explore Table Mountain, a flat-topped part of the mountain protected under the National Parks Board that features the highest concentration of endemic plant and animal species in any other area of its size – more than the entire UK.
highlightDetails: See panoramic views of the breathtaking surrounding areas
Explore the local flora and fauna of Table Mountain
Take a cable car to/from Table Mountain
activities.introduction: Take a cable car up to Table Mountain, one of Cape Town’s most beautiful landmarks where you’ll be able to take in the views and explore freely.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is weather dependent
Views are weather dependent
This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as long as Sailors can navigate a few steps on their own
Tour is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights
This Shore Thing is only available for in-transit Sailors returning to the ship
Sailors may encounter lines for the cable car at Table Mountain and delays may occur
